product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by RihannaMatch Stix Contour Skinstick
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeThe FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Contour Skinstick is a contour stick in a longwear, light-as-air matte formula in a range of shades for all skin tones.
details: DetailsBenefitsCream-to-powder formulaBuildable, easy to blendLightweight, no creasing or cakingEasy-to-use stick format that's perfect for targeted application anywhere you want to contourFeaturesMagnets often use nonrenewable resources, so in December 2021, we began phasing them out of our Match Stix collections to help lower our environmental impact. Although we are removing magnets, everything else you know and love about the formula and packaging is the same.Formulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensItem 2592591How To UseAfter applying your foundation or on bare skin, apply to areas of your face you want to contour such as the hollows of your cheeks, jawline, and sides of your nose. Blend with fingers or brush.Artistry pro tip: Use your fingers to warm the product on the back of your hand before tapping onto skin.IngredientsTricaprylin, C12-15 Alkyl Ethylhexanoate, Polyethylene, Polymethyl Methacrylate, Octyldodecanol, Sucrose Acetate Isobutyrate, Mica, Cera Microcristallina/Microcrystalline Wax/Cire Microcristalline, Octyldodecyl Neopentanoate, Silica, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Caprylyl Glycol, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Vp/Eicosene Copolymer, Vp/Hexadecene Copolymer, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Tocopherol, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Polyethylene Terephthalate, Acrylates Copolymer, Tin Oxide. May Contain/Peut Contenir (+/-): Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After applying your foundation or on bare skin, apply to areas of your face you want to contour such as the hollows of your cheeks, jawline, and sides of your nose. Blend with fingers or brush.Artistry pro tip: Use your fingers to warm the product on the back of your hand before tapping onto skin.

reviews.comments: This contour stick is a gem! I absolutely love how easy this product blends into my skinâ€”such a bold yet classy contouring effect.

reviews.headline: Looks amazing
reviews.comments: This is perfect it blends well and looks natural on. It honestly is delightful

reviews.headline: Not the best.
reviews.comments: Not the best.

reviews.headline: Good but theres better
reviews.comments: The first thing i noticed about this contour stick was how little product you get for the big price. The packaging also feels like cheap plastic. As a brand, fenty has always been one of my favorites however they do have some products i dont like, including this one. In terms of functionality, it works fine, it does the job but i will say there are better brands out there that have a more blendable and smoother formula.

reviews.headline: Cool toned
reviews.comments: Amber is a great color for those looking for a cool toned contour, but every single time I use this, I break out exactly where I put the product!

reviews.headline: yuk
reviews.comments: worst make up ever purchased

reviews.headline: Easy to use
reviews.comments: Ive seen a lot of people say this is hard to blend but i find it blends out super easily with a brush. This is so easy for me to use if im trying to do my makeup quickly or im doing it in the car. Ive had mine for close to a year and still have a lot of product left as well.

reviews.headline: Hate to hate this
reviews.comments: I love the color but every time i use this no matter how i apply it takes my makeup underneath off and looks terrible. I guess i will try it under my foundation???

reviews.headline: Found my perfect match
reviews.comments:
I honestly struggled finding a good contour that was cool toned - I tried taking the easy way using bronzer and that was NOT the same thing. This applies so smoothly and gently and I don't need a lot so this will
last me awhile.

reviews.headline: I like it
reviews.comments: This is my first time trying Fenty Beauty & I love this. Glides on smoothly & blends well. I just wish I got a shade darker. I will be ordering again.

reviews.headline: They decreased amount of actual product
reviews.comments: This match stick was my go-to for contouring. The shade is a perfect brown grey and was easy to blend. While I dont think they changed the formula, they definitely changed the packaging and decreased the amount of product u get. One of these used to last me probably over 6 months, and when I reordered it the packaging not only looks significantly cheaper, the amount of product you get lasts ljke 2, max. Im going to look for an alternative

reviews.headline: Very nice!
reviews.comments: Gets the job done. I put it on my cheekbones, nose, and forehead, and I love how it makes me look. I don't wear a lot of makeup and try not to buy products I can't apply with my fingers, so this was perfect! A little expensive, but has lasted a long time.

reviews.headline: THE best easily available cool tone contour
reviews.comments: I don't know why in 2025, brands still insist that every contour stick function like a cream bronzer that turns orange. But this beauty here is the exception. Any of the shades with the word Amber in them, depending on your skin depth, create a beautiful, natural shadow look (an actual contour!) as well as warmer shades for summer and shades all the way to ebony.  The shade range includes the fairest to deepest skin tones, and that is rare.  It also is beginner friendly since you can just draw it on and blend it out with nearly any sponge or brush.

reviews.headline: Too little product for the price
reviews.comments: This product blends really well and the shade looks so good on me. it applies well and it's a great product, I just cannot use a product that has less product volume than my pinkie finger for $30+.

reviews.headline: AMAZING Must BUY!!
reviews.comments: this stick is so durable and pigmented! it def takes a bit of an arm workout to blend but with a beauty blender and patience it's super worth it! i've been using mine for the past 5 months and it still looks like it has barely been used so you definitely are getting your money's worth out of this! any fenty beauty product is usually worth it

reviews.headline: good product
reviews.comments:
so ive had my fenty contour for about 8-9 months and im still not even halfway done with it (to be fair i only do nose contour). however, it's super pricey for the amount of product you get and i wanted to start crying when i went to checkout. i would recommend it though 

i got the amber shade, and i have light olive skin/warm undertones

reviews.headline: Nice
reviews.comments: It's good, doesn't wow me and I wish it was cheaper. Probably won't buy again, but that's not to say it's not a good product.

reviews.headline: It does what it is supposed to
reviews.comments: I think the color I got is a little orange for me, but the product is nice.

reviews.headline: nope nope nope
reviews.comments: nope, this stick turns my foundation green

reviews.headline: Beauty Repurchase
reviews.comments: I am on my second or third tube of this product.  I like the buildability of the Amber shade.  I feel like this doesn't make me look dirty or orange like some products do.  The formula blends nicely and doesn't seem cakey or over dry.  As long as I keep my hands off my face, this will lasts throughout my day.   My skin has become more dry over the last year or so and I do note that it seems to bring out the dry in my skin after a few hours.  But that is my sign I need to step up my water consumption and moisturizer game.

media.headline: Color changed
media.caption: The top swatch is the original and the bottom swatch is the new formula. Both were blended using my normal techniques. The top melts into the skin and leaves a perfect "shadow" whereas the bottom is sitting on the skin and looks very warm.

media.headline: a rip off for the amount of product
media.caption: not worth 32 for this much product and drugstore-feeling packaging imo

media.headline: I don't think I will buy again
media.caption: 1 inch of product in a 4 inch tube.

media.headline: I No Longer Trust Fenty!
media.caption: As you can see these are two entirely different tones. The shade Amber is no longer a cool-toned taupe for contour and shadow. It's a greasy new formula that doesn't set, and it's so greasy it came with a dent too.

faceoff_positive.comments: I have a fair, extremely cool toned complexion. This makes contouring a nightmare for me, because many companies enjoy combining the concepts of bronzer w/ contour, resulting in almost exclusively warm undertones even when they're advertised as neutral. Because of this, I have spent most of my life LOVING makeup and learning every other technique except for contour because any time I tried, my skin turned out muddy. I'm truly in awe of Rihanna's line - it's a complete testament to the inclusivity of this line that she was able to produce a product for fair-skin that STILL I have yet to see from ANY other company, despite many other companies almost exclusively pandering to pale skin for years (save for maybe 1 or 2 darker shades in a line of 60). The formula is awesome, it blends SO well - I don't usually wear foundation and it's creamy enough to blend into a seamless, natural shadow. It also truly glides on the skin with little effort. The packaging is also (personally) accessible (to me for my condition) - I have peripheral neuropathy which can make it difficult to use my hands some days, particularly opening / twisting motions and w/ precision, and I've never struggled with opening, holding, or controlling this particular product. I'm already on my 3rd re-purchase, and will continue repurchasing for as long as they make it.
faceoff_positive.headline: The ONLY, TRUE cool-toned cream contour I could find

faceoff_negative.comments:
I no longer trust Fenty. The Amber shade changed, looks nothing like the photo anywhere it's sold, not even here! I've used the shade Amber since it was first released and they changed the formula but worse, the shade is completely different! 

It used to be this beautiful cool toned taupe brown contour shade that blended out perfectly to a natural matte finish. This new formula is greasy and won't set no matter how I try. The worst part, the shade is TOTALLY DIFFERENT and looks so strange, so terrible. And before you ask, yes, I did check the labeling. 

It now has this strange yellow cast that looks like a greasy yellowish jaundice like tan. Not at all appropriate as a contour, not even a bronzer. It looks nothing like the photo anymore. This new version is a greasy, almost transparent and barely pigmented. It barely shows up. It's like rubbing yellow grease on your neck and face. 

Thinking I received a bad batch, I started reading other reviews. Looks like I am not alone. They changed the shade and failed to let us know and failed to update their images and description anywhere. This new version of "Amber" is not for cool undertones and definitely not cool toned as described. it's quite yellow. The old version was perfect for casting shadows in contouring. This new version is far less pigmented, very slick and greasy and doesn't blend and never sets.

Frankly, I am shocked no one has taken to social media with this because it's such a dramatic difference. I'm sure this will eventually happen, but I would absolutely not trust this brand after this experience. Cool toned is listed in the description yet it's yellow. 

The packaging has also changed. It is lighter weight plastic and lacks the original magnet that held these together. Honestly, I could care less about the packaging - it's the fact that I was lied to about the shade I spent my hard earned money on. It's not right to change a formula and a shade and not tell anyone. At least update the information so we can make an informed decision before making a purchase.
faceoff_negative.headline: I No Longer Trust Fenty!
